OscalSspSystemSecurityPlanAssemblyType.title: System Security Plan (SSP)
OscalSspSystemSecurityPlanAssemblyType.description: A system security plan, such as those described in NIST SP 800-18.

OscalSspSystemSecurityPlanUuidFlagType.title: System Security Plan Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspSystemSecurityPlanUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this system security plan (SSP) elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `SSP` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalMetadataMetadataAssemblyType.title: Document Metadata
OscalMetadataMetadataAssemblyType.description:
Provides information about the containing document, and defines concepts that are shared across the document.

All OSCAL documents use the same metadata structure, that provides a consistent way of expressing OSCAL document metadata across all OSCAL models. The metadata section also includes declarations of individual objects (i.e., roles, location, parties) that may be referenced within and across linked OSCAL documents.

The metadata in an OSCAL document has few required fields, representing only the bare minimum data needed to differentiate one instance from another. Tools and users creating OSCAL documents may choose to use any of the optional fields, as well as extension mechanisms (e.g., properties, links) to go beyond this minimum to suit their use cases.

A publisher of OSCAL content can use the `published`, `last-modified`, and `version` fields to establish information about an individual in a sequence of successive revisions of a given OSCAL-based publication. The metadata for a previous revision can be represented as a `revision` within this object. Links may also be provided using the `predecessor-version` and `successor-version` link relations to provide for direct access to the related resource. These relations can be provided as a link child of this object or as `link` within a given `revision`.

A `responsible-party` entry in this context refers to roles and parties that have responsibility relative to the production, review, publication, and use of the containing document.

OscalMetadataMetadataTitleFieldType.title: Document Title
OscalMetadataMetadataTitleFieldType.description: A name given to the document, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

OscalMetadataPublishedFieldType.title: Publication Timestamp
OscalMetadataPublishedFieldType.description:
The date and time the document was last made available.

Typically, this date value will be machine-generated at the time the containing document is published.

In some cases, an OSCAL document may be derived from some source material provided in a different format. In such a case, the `published` value should indicate when the OSCAL document instance was last published, not the source material.

OscalMetadataLastModifiedFieldType.title: Last Modified Timestamp
OscalMetadataLastModifiedFieldType.description:
The date and time the document was last stored for later retrieval.

This value represents the point in time when the OSCAL document was last updated, or at the point of creation the creation date. Typically, this date value will be machine generated at time of creation or modification. Ideally, this field will be managed by the editing tool or service used to make modifications when storing the modified document.

The intent of the last modified timestamp is to distinguish between significant change milestones when the document may be accessed by multiple entities. This allows a given entity to differentiate between mutiple document states at specific points in time. It is possible to make multiple modifications to the document without storing these changes. In such a case, the last modified timestamp might not be updated until the document is finally stored.

In some cases, an OSCAL document may be derived from some source material in a different format. In such a case, the `last-modified` value should indicate the last modification time of the OSCAL document instance, not the source material.

OscalMetadataVersionFieldType.title: Document Version
OscalMetadataVersionFieldType.description:
Used to distinguish a specific revision of an OSCAL document from other previous and future versions.

A version may be a release number, sequence number, date, or other identifier sufficient to distinguish between different document revisions.

While not required, it is recommended that OSCAL content authors use [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html) as the version format. This allows for the easy identification of a version tree consisting of major, minor, and patch numbers.

A version is typically set by the document owner or by the tool used to maintain the content.

OscalMetadataOscalVersionFieldType.title: OSCAL Version
OscalMetadataOscalVersionFieldType.description:
The OSCAL model version the document was authored against and will conform to as valid.

Indicates the version of the OSCAL model to which the document conforms, for example "1.1.0" or "1.0.0-milestone1". That can be used as a hint for a tool indicating which version of the OSCAL XML or JSON schema to use for validation.

The OSCAL version serves a different purpose from the document version and is used to represent a different concept. If both have the same value, this is coincidental.

OscalMetadataMetadataRevisionAssemblyTyp.title: Revision History Entry
OscalMetadataMetadataRevisionAssemblyTyp.description:
An entry in a sequential list of revisions to the containing document, expected to be in reverse chronological order (i.e. latest first).

While `published`, `last-modified`, and `oscal-version` are not required, values for these entries should be provided if the information is known. A `link` with a `rel` of "source" should be provided if the information is known.

OscalMetadataMetadataRevisionTitleFieldT.title: Document Title
OscalMetadataMetadataRevisionTitleFieldT.description: A name given to the document revision, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

OscalMetadataPropAssemblyType.title: Property
OscalMetadataPropAssemblyType.description:
An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order, and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure consistency.

Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context of the containing object.

OscalMetadataPropNameFlagType.title: Property Name
OscalMetadataPropNameFlagType.description: A textual label, within a namespace, that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or quality of the property's containing object.

OscalMetadataPropUuidFlagType.title: Property Universally Unique Identifier
OscalMetadataPropUuidFlagType.description: A unique identifier for a property.

OscalMetadataPropNsFlagType.title: Property Namespace
OscalMetadataPropNsFlagType.description:
A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

When a `ns` is not provided, its value should be assumed to be `http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal` and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.

OscalMetadataPropValueFlagType.title: Property Value
OscalMetadataPropValueFlagType.description: Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.

OscalMetadataPropClassFlagType.title: Property Class
OscalMetadataPropClassFlagType.description:
A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's `name`.

This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple properties of the same object with the same `name` and `ns`, or to group properties into categories.

A `class` can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of a specific `class` value. It is available for grouping, but unlike `group` is not expected specifically to designate any group membership as such.

OscalMetadataPropGroupFlagType.title: Property Group
OscalMetadataPropGroupFlagType.description:
An identifier for relating distinct sets of properties.

Different sets of properties may relate to separate contexts. Declare a group on a property to associate it with one or more other properties in a given context.

OscalMetadataRemarksFieldType.title: Remarks
OscalMetadataRemarksFieldType.description:
Additional commentary about the containing object.

The `remarks` field SHOULD not be used to store arbitrary data. Instead, a `prop` or `link` should be used to annotate or reference any additional data not formally supported by OSCAL.

OscalMetadataLinkAssemblyType.title: Link
OscalMetadataLinkAssemblyType.description:
A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to a back matter `resource` is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the `rlink/hash` object.

The OSCAL `link` is a roughly based on the HTML [link element](https://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/links.html#edef-LINK).

OscalMetadataLinkHrefFlagType.title: Hypertext Reference
OscalMetadataLinkHrefFlagType.description:
A resolvable URL reference to a resource.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to an OSCAL object by the objects identifier (e.g., id, uuid) in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)). The specific object type will differ based on the link relationship type.

OscalMetadataLinkRelFlagType.title: Link Relation Type
OscalMetadataLinkRelFlagType.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link's hypertext reference. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

OscalMetadataMediaTypeFlagType.title: Media Type
OscalMetadataMediaTypeFlagType.description:
A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) [Media
Types Registry](https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) defines a standardized set of media types, which may be used
here.

The `application/oscal+xml`, `application/oscal+json` or `application/oscal+yaml` media types SHOULD be used when referencing OSCAL XML, JSON, or YAML resources respectively.

\*\*Note: There is no official media type for YAML at this time.\*\* OSCAL documents should specify `application/yaml` for general YAML content, or `application/oscal+yaml` for YAML-based OSCAL content. This approach aligns with use of a structured name suffix, per [RFC 6838 Section 4.2.8](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6838.html#section-4.2.8).

Some earlier OSCAL content incorporated the model into the media type. For example: `application/oscal.catalog+xml`. This practice SHOULD be avoided, since the OSCAL model can be detected by parsing the initial content of the referenced resource.

OscalMetadataLinkResourceFragmentFlagTyp.title: Resource Fragment
OscalMetadataLinkResourceFragmentFlagTyp.description: In case where the `href` points to a `back-matter/resource`, this value will indicate the URI [fragment](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986#section-3.5) to append to any `rlink` associated with the resource. This value MUST be [URI encoded](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986#section-2.1).

OscalMetadataLinkTextFieldType.title: Link Text
OscalMetadataLinkTextFieldType.description: A textual label to associate with the link, which may be used for presentation in a tool.

OscalMetadataDocumentIdFieldType.title: Document Identifier
OscalMetadataDocumentIdFieldType.description:
A document identifier qualified by an identifier `scheme`.

A document identifier provides a [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with a [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that is used for a group of documents that are to be treated as different versions, representations or digital surrogates of the same document.

A document identifier provides an additional data point for identifying a document that can be assigned by a publisher or organization for purposes in a wider system, such as a digital object identifier (DOI) or a local content management system identifier.

Use of a document identifier allows for document creators to associate sets of documents that are related in some way by the same `document-id`.

An OSCAL document always has an implicit document identifier provided by the document's UUID, defined by the `uuid` on the top-level object. Having a default UUID-based identifier ensures all documents can be minimally identified when other document identifiers are not provided.

OscalMetadataDocumentIdSchemeFlagType.title: Document Identification Scheme
OscalMetadataDocumentIdSchemeFlagType.description:
Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

OscalMetadataMetadataRoleAssemblyType.title: Role
OscalMetadataMetadataRoleAssemblyType.description:
Defines a function, which might be assigned to a party in a specific situation.

Permissible values to be determined closer to the application (e.g. by a receiving authority).

OSCAL has defined a set of standardized roles for consistent use in OSCAL documents. This allows tools consuming OSCAL content to infer specific semantics when these roles are used. These roles are documented in the specific contexts of their use (e.g., responsible-party, responsible-role). When using such a role, it is necessary to define these roles in this list, which will then allow such a role to be referenced.

OscalMetadataMetadataRoleIdFlagType.title: Role Identifier
OscalMetadataMetadataRoleIdFlagType.description: A unique identifier for the role.

OscalMetadataMetadataRoleTitleFieldType.title: Role Title
OscalMetadataMetadataRoleTitleFieldType.description: A name given to the role, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

OscalMetadataMetadataRoleShortNameFieldT.title: Role Short Name
OscalMetadataMetadataRoleShortNameFieldT.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the role.

OscalMetadataMetadataRoleDescriptionFiel.title: Role Description
OscalMetadataMetadataRoleDescriptionFiel.description: A summary of the role's purpose and associated responsibilities.

OscalMetadataMetadataLocationAssemblyTyp.title: Location
OscalMetadataMetadataLocationAssemblyTyp.description:
A physical point of presence, which may be associated with people, organizations, or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

An address might be sensitive in nature. In such cases a title, mailing address, email-address, and/or phone number may be used instead.

OscalMetadataMetadataLocationUuidFlagTyp.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier
OscalMetadataMetadataLocationUuidFlagTyp.description: A unique ID for the location, for reference.

OscalMetadataMetadataLocationTitleFieldT.title: Location Title
OscalMetadataMetadataLocationTitleFieldT.description: A name given to the location, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

OscalMetadataAddressAssemblyType.title: Address
OscalMetadataAddressAssemblyType.description: A postal address for the location.

OscalMetadataAddrLineFieldType.title: Address line
OscalMetadataAddrLineFieldType.description: A single line of an address.

OscalMetadataAddressCityFieldType.title: City
OscalMetadataAddressCityFieldType.description: City, town or geographical region for the mailing address.

OscalMetadataAddressStateFieldType.title: State
OscalMetadataAddressStateFieldType.description: State, province or analogous geographical region for a mailing address.

OscalMetadataAddressPostalCodeFieldType.title: Postal Code
OscalMetadataAddressPostalCodeFieldType.description: Postal or ZIP code for mailing address.

OscalMetadataAddressCountryFieldType.title: Country Code
OscalMetadataAddressCountryFieldType.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the mailing address.

OscalMetadataEmailAddressFieldType.title: Email Address
OscalMetadataEmailAddressFieldType.description:
An email address as defined by [RFC 5322 Section
3.4.1](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5322#section-3.4.1).

OscalMetadataTelephoneNumberFieldType.title: Telephone Number
OscalMetadataTelephoneNumberFieldType.description: A telephone service number as defined by [ITU-T E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164-201011-I/en).

OscalMetadataTelephoneNumberTypeFlagType.title: type flag
OscalMetadataTelephoneNumberTypeFlagType.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

OscalMetadataMetadataLocationUrlFieldTyp.title: Location URL
OscalMetadataMetadataLocationUrlFieldTyp.description:
The uniform resource locator (URL) for a web site or other resource associated with the location.

This data field is deprecated in favor of using a link with an appropriate relationship.

OscalMetadataMetadataPartyAssemblyType.title: Party
OscalMetadataMetadataPartyAssemblyType.description:
An organization or person, which may be associated with roles or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

A party can be optionally associated with either an address or a location. While providing a meaningful location for a party is desired, there are some cases where it might not be possible to provide an exact location or even any location.

OscalMetadataMetadataPartyUuidFlagType.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier
OscalMetadataMetadataPartyUuidFlagType.description: A unique identifier for the party.

OscalMetadataMetadataPartyTypeFlagType.title: Party Type
OscalMetadataMetadataPartyTypeFlagType.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

OscalMetadataMetadataPartyNameFieldType.title: Party Name
OscalMetadataMetadataPartyNameFieldType.description: The full name of the party. This is typically the legal name associated with the party.

OscalMetadataMetadataPartyShortNameField.title: Party Short Name
OscalMetadataMetadataPartyShortNameField.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the party.

OscalMetadataMetadataPartyExternalIdFiel.title: Party External Identifier
OscalMetadataMetadataPartyExternalIdFiel.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID).

OscalMetadataMetadataPartyExternalIdSche.title: External Identifier Schema
OscalMetadataMetadataPartyExternalIdSche.description:
Indicates the type of external identifier.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

OscalMetadataLocationUuidFieldType.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier Reference
OscalMetadataLocationUuidFieldType.description: Reference to a location by UUID.

OscalMetadataMetadataPartyMemberOfOrgani.title: Organizational Affiliation
OscalMetadataMetadataPartyMemberOfOrgani.description:
A reference to another `party` by UUID, typically an organization, that this subject is associated with.

Since the reference target of an organizational affiliation must be another `party` (whether further qualified as person or organization) as inidcated by its `uuid`. As a [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier with uniqueness across document and trans-document scope, this `uuid` value is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally across related documents, e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance.

Parties of both the `person` or `organization` type can be associated with an organization using the `member-of-organization`.

OscalMetadataResponsiblePartyAssemblyTyp.title: Responsible Party
OscalMetadataResponsiblePartyAssemblyTyp.description:
A reference to a set of persons and/or organizations that have responsibility for performing the referenced role in the context of the containing object.

A `responsible-party` requires one or more `party-uuid` references creating a strong relationship arc between the referenced `role-id` and the reference parties. This differs in semantics from `responsible-role` which doesn't require that a `party-uuid` is referenced.

The scope of use of this object determines if the responsibility has been performed or will be performed in the future. The containing object will describe the intent.

OscalMetadataResponsiblePartyRoleIdFlagT.title: Responsible Role
OscalMetadataResponsiblePartyRoleIdFlagT.description: A reference to a `role` performed by a `party`.

OscalMetadataPartyUuidFieldType.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier Reference
OscalMetadataPartyUuidFieldType.description: Reference to a party by UUID.

OscalMetadataActionAssemblyType.title: Action
OscalMetadataActionAssemblyType.description: An action applied by a role within a given party to the content.

OscalMetadataActionUuidFlagType.title: Action Universally Unique Identifier
OscalMetadataActionUuidFlagType.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined action elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions of the document.

OscalMetadataActionDateFlagType.title: Action Occurrence Date
OscalMetadataActionDateFlagType.description: The date and time when the action occurred.

OscalMetadataActionTypeFlagType.title: Action Type
OscalMetadataActionTypeFlagType.description: The type of action documented by the assembly, such as an approval.

OscalMetadataActionSystemFlagType.title: Action Type System
OscalMetadataActionSystemFlagType.description:
Specifies the action type system used.

Provides a means to segment the value space for the `type`, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed `action`'s `type`. This allows the semantics associated with a given `type` to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.

An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.

OscalSspImportProfileAssemblyType.title: Import Profile
OscalSspImportProfileAssemblyType.description: Used to import the OSCAL profile representing the system's control baseline.

OscalSspImportProfileHrefFlagType.title: Profile Reference
OscalSspImportProfileHrefFlagType.description:
A resolvable URL reference to the profile or catalog to use as the system's control baseline.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

If the resource is an OSCAL profile, it is expected that a tool will resolve the profile according to the OSCAL [profile resolution specification](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/processing/profile-resolution/) to produce a resolved profile for use when processing the containing system security plan. This allows a system security plan processor to use the baseline as a catalog of controls.

While it is possible to reference a previously resolved OSCAL profile as a catalog, this practice is discouraged since the unresolved form of the profile communicates more information about selections and changes to the underlying catalog. Furthermore, the underlying catalog can be maintained separately from the profile, which also has maintenance advantages for distinct maintainers, ensuring that the best available information is produced through profile resolution.

OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsAssemblyTyp.title: System Characteristics
OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsAssemblyTyp.description: Contains the characteristics of the system, such as its name, purpose, and security impact level.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemIdFieldTy.title: System Identification
OscalImplementationCommonSystemIdFieldTy.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this system identification property elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). When referencing an externally defined `system identification`, the `system identification` must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference). This string should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same system across revisions of the document.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemIdIdentif.title: Identification System Type
OscalImplementationCommonSystemIdIdentif.description:
Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSystemNameF.title: System Name - Full
OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSystemNameF.description: The full name of the system.

OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSystemNameS.title: System Name - Short
OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSystemNameS.description:
A short name for the system, such as an acronym, that is suitable for display in a data table or summary list.

Since `system-name-short` is optional, if the `system-name-short` is not provided, the `system-name` can be used as a substitute.

OscalSspDateAuthorizedFieldType.title: System Authorization Date
OscalSspDateAuthorizedFieldType.description: The date the system received its authorization.

OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSecuritySen.title: Security Sensitivity Level
OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSecuritySen.description:
The overall information system sensitivity categorization, such as defined by [FIPS-199](https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.FIPS.199).

Often, organizations require the security sensitivity level to correspond with the highest confidentiality, integrity, or availability level identified by `security-impact-level`.

OscalSspSystemInformationAssemblyType.title: System Information
OscalSspSystemInformationAssemblyType.description: Contains details about all information types that are stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in [NIST SP 800-60](https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-60v2r1).

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: Contains details about one information type that is stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in [NIST SP 800-60](https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-60v2r1).

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this information type elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `information type` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: title field
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A human readable name for the information type. This title should be meaningful within the context of the system.

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Description
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A summary of how this information type is used within the system.

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Categorization
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A set of information type identifiers qualified by the given identification `system` used, such as NIST SP 800-60.

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Identification System
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description:
Specifies the information type identification system used.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Systematized Identifier
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier qualified by the given identification `system` used, such as NIST SP 800-60. This identifier has [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope and can be used to reference this system elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). This id should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspImpactAssemblyType.title: Impact Level
OscalSspImpactAssemblyType.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the described information.

OscalSspBaseFieldType.title: Base Level (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability)
OscalSspBaseFieldType.description: The prescribed base (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

OscalSspSelectedFieldType.title: Selected Level (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability)
OscalSspSelectedFieldType.description: The selected (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

OscalSspAdjustmentJustificationFieldType.title: Adjustment Justification
OscalSspAdjustmentJustificationFieldType.description: If the selected security level is different from the base security level, this contains the justification for the change.

OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelAssemblyType.title: Security Impact Level
OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelAssemblyType.description: The overall level of expected impact resulting from unauthorized disclosure, modification, or loss of access to information.

OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.title: Security Objective: Confidentiality
OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.description: A target-level of confidentiality for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.title: Security Objective: Integrity
OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.description: A target-level of integrity for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.title: Security Objective: Availability
OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.description: A target-level of availability for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

OscalSspStatusAssemblyType.title: Status
OscalSspStatusAssemblyType.description:
Describes the operational status of the system.

If 'other' is selected, a remark must be included to describe the current state.

OscalSspAuthorizationBoundaryAssemblyTyp.title: Authorization Boundary
OscalSspAuthorizationBoundaryAssemblyTyp.description: A description of this system's authorization boundary, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the authorization boundary.

OscalSspAuthorizationBoundaryDescription.title: Authorization Boundary Description
OscalSspAuthorizationBoundaryDescription.description: A summary of the system's authorization boundary.

OscalSspDiagramAssemblyType.title: Diagram
OscalSspDiagramAssemblyType.description:
A graphic that provides a visual representation the system, or some aspect of it.

A diagram must include a `link` with a rel value of "diagram", who's href references a remote URI or an internal reference within this document containing the diagram.

OscalSspDiagramUuidFlagType.title: Diagram ID
OscalSspDiagramUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this diagram elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `diagram` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspDiagramDescriptionFieldType.title: Diagram Description
OscalSspDiagramDescriptionFieldType.description:
A summary of the diagram.

This description is intended to be used as alternate text to support compliance with requirements from [Section 508 of the United States Workforce Rehabilitation Act of 1973](https://www.section508.gov/manage/laws-and-policies).

OscalSspDiagramCaptionFieldType.title: Caption
OscalSspDiagramCaptionFieldType.description: A brief caption to annotate the diagram.

OscalSspNetworkArchitectureAssemblyType.title: Network Architecture
OscalSspNetworkArchitectureAssemblyType.description: A description of the system's network architecture, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the network architecture.

OscalSspNetworkArchitectureDescriptionFi.title: Network Architecture Description
OscalSspNetworkArchitectureDescriptionFi.description: A summary of the system's network architecture.

OscalSspDataFlowAssemblyType.title: Data Flow
OscalSspDataFlowAssemblyType.description: A description of the logical flow of information within the system and across its boundaries, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate these flows.

OscalSspDataFlowDescriptionFieldType.title: Data Flow Description
OscalSspDataFlowDescriptionFieldType.description: A summary of the system's data flow.

OscalSspSystemImplementationAssemblyType.title: System Implementation
OscalSspSystemImplementationAssemblyType.description: Provides information as to how the system is implemented.

OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.title: Leveraged Authorization
OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.description: A description of another authorized system from which this system inherits capabilities that satisfy security requirements. Another term for this concept is a *common control provider*.

OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.title: Leveraged Authorization Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope and can be used to reference this leveraged authorization elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `leveraged authorization` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.title: title field
OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.description: A human readable name for the leveraged authorization in the context of the system.

OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.title: party-uuid field
OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to the `party` that manages the leveraged system.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserAssem.title: System User
OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserAssem.description:
A type of user that interacts with the system based on an associated role.

Permissible values to be determined closer to the application, such as by a receiving authority.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserUuidF.title: User Universally Unique Identifier
OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserUuidF.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this user class elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `system user` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserTitle.title: User Title
OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserTitle.description: A name given to the user, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserShort.title: User Short Name
OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserShort.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the user.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserDescr.title: User Description
OscalImplementationCommonSystemUserDescr.description: A summary of the user's purpose within the system.

OscalMetadataRoleIdFieldType.title: Role Identifier Reference
OscalMetadataRoleIdFieldType.description: Reference to a role by UUID.

OscalImplementationCommonAuthorizedPrivi.title: Privilege
OscalImplementationCommonAuthorizedPrivi.description: Identifies a specific system privilege held by the user, along with an associated description and/or rationale for the privilege.

OscalImplementationCommonAuthorizedPrivi.title: Privilege Title
OscalImplementationCommonAuthorizedPrivi.description: A human readable name for the privilege.

OscalImplementationCommonAuthorizedPrivi.title: Privilege Description
OscalImplementationCommonAuthorizedPrivi.description: A summary of the privilege's purpose within the system.

OscalImplementationCommonFunctionPerform.title: Functions Performed
OscalImplementationCommonFunctionPerform.description: Describes a function performed for a given authorized privilege by this user class.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.title: Component
OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.description:
A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

Components may be products, services, application programming interface (APIs), policies, processes, plans, guidance, standards, or other tangible items that enable security and/or privacy.

The `type` indicates which of these component types is represented.

When defining a `service` component where are relationship to other components is known, one or more `link` entries with rel values of provided-by and used-by can be used to link to the specific component identifier(s) that provide and use the service respectively.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.title: Component Identifier
OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this component elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `component` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.title: Component Type
OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.title: Component Title
OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.description: A human readable name for the system component.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.title: Component Description
OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.title: Purpose
OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.title: Status
OscalImplementationCommonSystemComponent.description: Describes the operational status of the system component.

OscalMetadataResponsibleRoleAssemblyType.title: Responsible Role
OscalMetadataResponsibleRoleAssemblyType.description:
A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

A `responsible-role` allows zero or more `party-uuid` references, each of which creates a relationship arc between the referenced `role-id` and the referenced party. This differs in semantics from `responsible-party`, which requires that at least one `party-uuid` is referenced.

The scope of use of this object determines if the responsibility has been performed or will be performed in the future. The containing object will describe the intent.

OscalMetadataResponsibleRoleRoleIdFlagTy.title: Responsible Role ID
OscalMetadataResponsibleRoleRoleIdFlagTy.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented) identifier reference to a `role` performed.

OscalImplementationCommonProtocolAssembl.title: Service Protocol Information
OscalImplementationCommonProtocolAssembl.description: Information about the protocol used to provide a service.

OscalImplementationCommonProtocolUuidFla.title: Service Protocol Information Universally Unique Identifier
OscalImplementationCommonProtocolUuidFla.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this service protocol information elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `service protocol` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalImplementationCommonProtocolNameFla.title: Protocol Name
OscalImplementationCommonProtocolNameFla.description:
The common name of the protocol, which should be the appropriate "service name" from the [IANA Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry](https://www.iana.org/assignments/service-names-port-numbers/service-names-port-numbers.xhtml).

The short name of the protocol (e.g., https).

OscalImplementationCommonProtocolTitleFi.title: Protocol Title
OscalImplementationCommonProtocolTitleFi.description: A human readable name for the protocol (e.g., Transport Layer Security).

OscalImplementationCommonPortRangeAssemb.title: Port Range
OscalImplementationCommonPortRangeAssemb.description:
Where applicable this is the IPv4 port range on which the service operates.

To be validated as a natural number (integer \>= 1). A single port uses the same value for start and end. Use multiple 'port-range' entries for non-contiguous ranges.

OscalImplementationCommonPortRangeStartF.title: Start
OscalImplementationCommonPortRangeStartF.description:
Indicates the starting port number in a port range

Should be a number within a permitted range

OscalImplementationCommonPortRangeEndFla.title: End
OscalImplementationCommonPortRangeEndFla.description:
Indicates the ending port number in a port range

Should be a number within a permitted range

OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemAs.title: Inventory Item
OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemAs.description: A single managed inventory item within the system.

OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemUu.title: Inventory Item Universally Unique Identifier
OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemUu.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this inventory item elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `inventory item` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemDe.title: Inventory Item Description
OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemDe.description: A summary of the inventory item stating its purpose within the system.

OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemIm.title: Implemented Component
OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemIm.description: The set of components that are implemented in a given system inventory item.

OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemIm.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
OscalImplementationCommonInventoryItemIm.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a `component` that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

OscalSspControlImplementationAssemblyTyp.title: Control Implementation
OscalSspControlImplementationAssemblyTyp.description:
Describes how the system satisfies a set of controls.

Use of `set-parameter` in this context, sets the parameter for all controls referenced by any `implemented-requirement` contained in this context. Any `set-parameter` defined in a child context will override this value. If not overridden by a child, this value applies in the child context.

OscalSspControlImplementationDescription.title: Control Implementation Description
OscalSspControlImplementationDescription.description: A statement describing important things to know about how this set of control satisfaction documentation is approached.

OscalImplementationCommonSetParameterAss.title: Set Parameter Value
OscalImplementationCommonSetParameterAss.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

OscalImplementationCommonParamIdFlagType.title: Parameter ID
OscalImplementationCommonParamIdFlagType.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented) reference to a `parameter` within a control, who's catalog has been imported into the current implementation context.

OscalImplementationCommonSetParameterVal.title: Parameter Value
OscalImplementationCommonSetParameterVal.description: A parameter value or set of values.

OscalSspImplementedRequirementAssemblyTy.title: Control-based Requirement
OscalSspImplementedRequirementAssemblyTy.description:
Describes how the system satisfies the requirements of an individual control.

Use of `set-parameter` in this context, sets the parameter for the referenced control. Any `set-parameter` defined in a child context will override this value. If not overridden by a child, this value applies in the child context.

OscalSspImplementedRequirementUuidFlagTy.title: Control Requirement Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspImplementedRequirementUuidFlagTy.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this control requirement elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `control requirement` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalControlCommonControlIdFlagType.title: Control Identifier Reference
OscalControlCommonControlIdFlagType.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding `id` value. When referencing an externally defined `control`, the `Control Identifier Reference` must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

OscalSspStatementAssemblyType.title: Specific Control Statement
OscalSspStatementAssemblyType.description: Identifies which statements within a control are addressed.

OscalImplementationCommonStatementIdFlag.title: Control Statement Reference
OscalImplementationCommonStatementIdFlag.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented) identifier reference to a `control statement`.

OscalSspStatementUuidFlagType.title: Control Statement Reference Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspStatementUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this control statement elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The *UUID* of the `control statement` in the source OSCAL instance is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).

OscalSspByComponentAssemblyType.title: Component Control Implementation
OscalSspByComponentAssemblyType.description:
Defines how the referenced component implements a set of controls.

Use of `set-parameter` in this context, sets the parameter for the control referenced in the containing `implemented-requirement` applied to the referenced component. If the `by-component` is used as a child of a `statement`, then the parameter value also applies only in the context of the referenced statement. If the same parameter is also set in the `control-implementation` or a specific `implemented-requirement`, then this `by-component/set-parameter` value will override the other value(s) in the context of the referenced component, control, and statement (if parent).

OscalSspByComponentComponentUuidFlagType.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
OscalSspByComponentComponentUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to the `component` that is implemeting a given control.

OscalSspByComponentUuidFlagType.title: By-Component Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this by-component entry elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `by-component` entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspByComponentDescriptionFieldType.title: Control Implementation Description
OscalSspByComponentDescriptionFieldType.description: An implementation statement that describes how a control or a control statement is implemented within the referenced system component.

OscalImplementationCommonImplementationS.title: Implementation Status
OscalImplementationCommonImplementationS.description: Indicates the degree to which the a given control is implemented.

OscalImplementationCommonImplementationS.title: Implementation State
OscalImplementationCommonImplementationS.description: Identifies the implementation status of the control or control objective.

OscalSspByComponentExportAssemblyType.title: Export
OscalSspByComponentExportAssemblyType.description: Identifies content intended for external consumption, such as with leveraged organizations.

OscalSspByComponentExportDescriptionFiel.title: Control Implementation Export Description
OscalSspByComponentExportDescriptionFiel.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be available to another system leveraging this system.

OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedAssembl.title: Provided Control Implementation
OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedAssembl.description: Describes a capability which may be inherited by a leveraging system.

OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedUuidFla.title: Provided Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedUuidFla.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this provided entry elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `provided` entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedDescrip.title: Provided Control Implementation Description
OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedDescrip.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be provided to another system leveraging this system.

OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityA.title: Control Implementation Responsibility
OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityA.description: Describes a control implementation responsibility imposed on a leveraging system.

OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityU.title: Responsibility Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityU.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this responsibility elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `responsibility` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspProvidedUuidFlagType.title: Provided UUID
OscalSspProvidedUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to an inherited control implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityD.title: Control Implementation Responsibility Description
OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityD.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system must implement to satisfy the control provided by a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentInheritedAssemblyType.title: Inherited Control Implementation
OscalSspByComponentInheritedAssemblyType.description: Describes a control implementation inherited by a leveraging system.

OscalSspByComponentInheritedUuidFlagType.title: Inherited Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentInheritedUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this inherited entry elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `inherited control implementation` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspByComponentInheritedDescriptionF.title: Inherited Control Implementation Description
OscalSspByComponentInheritedDescriptionF.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedAssemblyType.title: Satisfied Control Implementation Responsibility
OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedAssemblyType.description: Describes how this system satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedUuidFlagType.title: Satisfied Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this satisfied control implementation entry elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `control implementation` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspResponsibilityUuidFlagType.title: Responsibility UUID
OscalSspResponsibilityUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a control implementation that satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedDescriptionF.title: Satisfied Control Implementation Responsibility Description
OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedDescriptionF.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is implementing based on a requirement from a leveraged system.

OscalMetadataBackMatterAssemblyType.title: Back matter
OscalMetadataBackMatterAssemblyType.description:
A collection of resources that may be referenced from within the OSCAL document instance.

Provides a collection of identified `resource` objects that can be referenced by a `link` with a `rel` value of "reference" and an `href` value that is a fragment "#" followed by a reference to a reference's `uuid`. Other specialized link "rel" values also use this pattern when indicated in that context of use.

OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceAssemblyT.title: Resource
OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceAssemblyT.description:
A resource associated with content in the containing document instance. A resource may be directly included in the document using base64 encoding or may point to one or more equivalent internet resources.

A resource can be used in two ways. 1) it may point to an specific retrievable network resource using a `rlink`, or 2) it may be included as an attachment using a `base64`. A resource may contain multiple `rlink` and `base64` entries that represent alternative download locations (rlink) and attachments (base64) for the same resource.

Both rlink and base64 allow for a `media-type` to be specified, which is used to distinguish between different representations of the same resource (e.g., Microsoft Word, PDF). When multiple `rlink` and `base64` items are included for a given resource, all items must contain equivalent information. This allows the document consumer to choose a preferred item to process based on a the selected item's `media-type`. This is extremely important when the items represent OSCAL content that is represented in alternate formats (i.e., XML, JSON, YAML), allowing the same OSCAL data to be processed from any of the available formats indicated by the items.

When a resource includes a citation, then the `title` and `citation` properties must both be included.

OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceUuidFlagT.title: Resource Universally Unique Identifier
OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceUuidFlagT.description: A unique identifier for a resource.

OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceTitleFiel.title: Resource Title
OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceTitleFiel.description: An optional name given to the resource, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceDescripti.title: Resource Description
OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceDescripti.description: An optional short summary of the resource used to indicate the purpose of the resource.

OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceCitationA.title: Citation
OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceCitationA.description: An optional citation consisting of end note text using structured markup.

OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceRlinkAsse.title: Resource link
OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceRlinkAsse.description:
A URL-based pointer to an external resource with an optional hash for verification and change detection.

Multiple `rlink` objects can be included for a resource. In such a case, all provided `rlink` items are intended to be equivalent in content, but may differ in structure or format.

A `media-type` is used to identify the format of a given rlink, and can be used to differentiate items in a collection of rlinks. The `media-type` provides a hint to the OSCAL document consumer about the structure of the resource referenced by the `rlink`.

OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceRlinkHref.title: Hypertext Reference
OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceRlinkHref.description:
A resolvable URL pointing to the referenced resource.

This value may be either:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or

OscalMetadataHashFieldType.title: Hash
OscalMetadataHashFieldType.description: A representation of a cryptographic digest generated over a resource using a specified hash algorithm.

OscalMetadataHashAlgorithmFlagType.title: Hash algorithm
OscalMetadataHashAlgorithmFlagType.description:
The digest method by which a hash is derived.

Any other value used MUST be a value defined in the W3C [XML Security Algorithm Cross-Reference](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlsec-algorithms/#digest-method-uris) Digest Methods (W3C, April 2013) or [RFC 6931 Section 2.1.5](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6931#section-2.1.5) New SHA Functions.

OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceBase64Fie.title: Base64
OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceBase64Fie.description: A resource encoded using the Base64 alphabet defined by [RFC 2045](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc2045.html).

OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceBase64Fil.title: File Name
OscalMetadataBackMatterResourceBase64Fil.description: Name of the file before it was encoded as Base64 to be embedded in a `resource`. This is the name that will be assigned to the file when the file is decoded.

UUIDDatatype.description: A type 4 ('random' or 'pseudorandom') or type 5 UUID per RFC 4122.
